info.name: Techfesia2019
info.description: ## This is the collection of APIs for Techfesia2019 of IIIT Sri City

request.description: Submit username and password, get accessToken and refreshToken in return.
Submit refreshToken and get back another accessToken
Same as user_token_pair_obtain Staff Only
Same as user_token_refresh Staff Only
Same as user_token_pair_obtain Superuser Only
Same as user_token_pair_obtain Superuser Only

item.name: Revoke All Tokens (Sign Out from all devices)

request.description:
Revokes the given refresh tokens signing out the user from perticular device.

If no token is provided in body, then all tokens related to user are deleted, signing out the user from everywhere.

response.name: Revoke All Tokens (Sign out from Some Devices)

item.name: Revoke one token (Signout from one device)

request.description:
Revokes a single refresh token. i.e. signs out the user from a perticular device. 
A PUT method instead of DELETE is used here as DELETE doesn't support payloads.

response.name: Revoke one token (Signout from one device)

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description:
Get details of all the users.
set <field>=<value> to filter based on that value ex: username=test

set limit=x to show only x entries.
Then set page=y to view page y.
Example: if you set limit=3 and you want to view entry no. 7, then set page=3.

If you request for a page more than max no of pages, then expect the following response:

400 Bad Request
{
	message:"This page does not exist",
	"pageSize": 3,
	"noOfPages":5
}

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.
This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description:
Get details of a perticular user. 
Only the user herself or the staff/superuser can access this route

Shows the state of a user. Responds with one of the following strings:
  • disabled
  • normal
  • staff
  • superuser
      • If the user is a staff, then also provides an array containing the permissions of the user on each model. Note that a disabled user can not do anything even if s(he) was a superuser.

Create a new User. Mandatory fields are:
  • username
  • email
  • password

updates a user's details.
Do note that some fields might be immutable in which case a 422 will be returned
Also can not be used for updating password.

Updates the user's profile picture from o-auth provider like google/github
Name of o-auth provider should be specified in the payload. If not specified, take the first default provider available.

Throws 422 if o-auth is not enabled.
disables a user account, preventing him/her from logging in or perform any action
Delete a user account. Warning: There is no way to recover data once this request is sent. Consider disabling the account instead.

Tells which all auth modes are enabled for a user. Typically 2 modes will exist,
  • password (true or false)
  • o-auth (as an array containing providers)

creates a password for those users who are signed in via o-auth.
Will throw 422 if user already has password based auth enabled.

Changes the password of the user.
Will throw a 422 if user is logged in via o-auth or if old password is incorrect.

resets user password to a new password.
User must send a reset_token in payload that will most likely be emailed to him

response.name: Reset Password (invalid token)
